title: When did Kate Bush make it big? - Quora

response.answer_text: Her first song, Wuthering Heights, was a huge hit in 1978 in the U.K. She continued to have success here with almost every release since in the U.K. and Europe. In America she achieved much less recognition until 1985s Running Up That Hill. Many Americans therefore consider her a one hit wonder, whereas elsewhere she’s been very successful since the 70s. Having made a several hugely popular albums she stopped recording after the Red Shoes in 1994, to concentrate on bring up her son. She had released material since, but very rarely. She did one set of gigs in 2014 and never does interviews.

1978 here in the U.K - her debut single “Wuthering Heights” spent 4 weeks atop the U.K Single charts and the album it came from (“The Kick Inside”) did likewise in the album charts and sold over a million copies. Both single & album also charted in Australia. She never really looked back from there, though it took until 1985’s “The Hounds of Love” and its lead single “Running Up that Hill” for her to be noticed in the States.
